so if I understand well the goal would be to split the H of h2o because it was replaced with 3h? that's right?

"Industrial production is mainly from steam reforming natural gas, and less often from more energy-intensive methods such as the electrolysis of water.["

so wouldn't it be possible to electrolyse the radioactive water from the tank? o2 would be clean and only concentrated radioactive hydrogen would remain?

I D K... I am not a doctor, maybe doctor carl or judith knows?

so how to absorb and concentrate this 3H into something solid and compact?

I am deeply convinced that if rather than going full bore on the basic block of life (CO2), it would have been put forward 10 years ago, today, maybe an Heisenberg or Opennheimer could have solved it...
